name: Template Overide
author: Simon Prosser

sections.description:
Very simple, it lets you add custom css to your template so when you upgrade the template with the wordpress update function your changes are never lost!

Usage

go to the Theme Options menu and click template overide, now add your custom css.

Un-Installation

  • go to the Plugins main menu and find Template overide, then click Deactivate
  • delete the files from your wp-content/plugins directory
sections.installation:
• upload the contents of the zip file to your wp-content/plugins directory
  • go to the Plugins main menu and find Template Overide, then click Activate
  • go to the Theme Options menu and click template overide, now add your custom css.
sections.changelog:
0.8.1

  • Removed codepress
  • Tested working fine with wordpress 3.0

0.8

  • Lots of bugs fixed!
  • Added Enable/Disable button.

0.5.1

*2.8 ready

0.1

  • First release
